history.content:
Dear EECS 101,

I am a sophomore EECS-Engineering Math double major who is looking for/writing up cover letters for internships and research. As of now, I have my current research experience doing software development in an astrophysics lab (specifically building off of stellar population modeling code package), which I have started in the summer of 2020. In the long term, I am leaning towards machine learning and computational imaging for research and upper divs. As for internships, I am hoping to join SETI, NASA, and perhaps companies (Facebook, Google, hopefully).

Do any of the more senior members/students in the Piazza have any advice with regards to applying? I just hope I am not too late into the game. Who would be a great Professor to work with in research in EECS?
history.subject: Regarding Research and Internships
